title: BOJ Hopes to Flexibly Address Climate Change With New Lending Facility
body:
The Bank of Japan can flexibly respond to climate change with its new lending facility, while also limiting the central bank’s influence in the private sector, Deputy Gov. Masayoshi Amamiya said Wednesday.
In a speech, Mr. Amamiya called the bank’s lending facility “the world’s first such attempt, in that it ensures flexibility while avoiding involvement in micro-level resource allocation as much as possible.”
